Description:
Coordinate and monitor the end-to-end supply chain process, from procurement to distribution, ensuring timely delivery of products to customers.
Collaborate with various departments, including procurement, production, logistics, and sales, to align supply chain activities with overall business objectives.
Analyze and forecast demand trends, inventory levels, and sales data to optimize inventory management and prevent stockouts or overstock situations.
Manage supplier relationships, negotiate contracts, and maintain open lines of communication to ensure reliable and cost-effective sourcing of materials and services.
Evaluate supplier performance and conduct regular supplier audits to maintain quality standards and identify areas for improvement.
Develop and implement supply chain strategies to enhance operational efficiency, reduce lead times, and minimize costs.
Identify and address supply chain bottlenecks and inefficiencies, implementing process improvements to enhance overall supply chain performance.Skills
Skills:
Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Logistics, or a related field.
Proven experience (typically 2+ years) in supply chain management, logistics, or procurement.
Strong understanding of supply chain principles, including demand forecasting, inventory management, and supplier relationship management.
Proficiency in using supply chain management software, ERP systems, and other relevant tools.
Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions to improve supply chain performance.
Excellent communication and negotiation skills to effectively collaborate with suppliers and internal stakeholders.
Problem-solving abilities and the capability to address supply chain challenges creatively.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills to manage complex supply chain processes.
